awd_titl_txt: Structure and Shape of Nuclei at                            High Angular Momentum
awd_abstract_narration: This standard grant will provide partial support for two  graduate students to supervise the construction and  commissioning of the ICEBall-2 mini-orange spectrometers  within the Gammasphere array, a premier detection system  used by a large consortium of nuclear-structure physicists.  This large gamma-ray detector array is used to study the  complex level structure of nuclei in order to understand the  underlying nuclear structure.  The mini-orange spectrometers  allow measurements of internal conversion electrons, which  result from electromagnetic transitions between levels for  which there is no change in angular momentum, which  typically arise from interband transitions.  Observing these  transitions thus allows a more complete understanding of the  level schemes.  The research using this device will be  performed at the ATLAS facility at Argonne National  Laboratory.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: UNIVERSITY OF PITTSBURGH - OF THE COMMONWEALTH SYSTEM OF HIGHER EDUCATION
